title: Action Verbs and Simple Instructions

sections.title: Email Management
sections.content:
Managing your inbox efficiently requires knowing the basic actions you can perform on an email.

- **Reply**: Send a response to the sender.
- **Forward**: Send a received email to another person.
- **Archive**: Save an email in a folder for future reference.
- **CC (Carbon Copy)**: Send a copy of the email to other people.

sections.title: Common Action Verbs
sections.content:
- **Send**: Enviar.
- **Print**: Imprimir.
- **Delete**: Eliminar / Borrar.
- **Save**: Guardar.
- **Attach**: Adjuntar.
- **Check**: Revisar / Comprobar.

sections.title: Grammar: The Imperative
sections.content:
We use the imperative to give direct instructions or orders. It is very common in technical or administrative emails.

- **Affirmative**: Use the base form of the verb.
  - *Send the email.* (Envía el correo.)
  - *Print the document.* (Imprime el documento.)
- **Negative**: Use 'Don't' + base form.
  - *Don't delete that file.* (No borres ese archivo.)
  - *Don't reply yet.* (No respondas todavía.)

sections.title: Making Instructions Polite
sections.content:
In a professional setting, we often add 'Please' to make instructions sound more polite.

- **Please attach the file.** (Por favor, adjunta el archivo.)
- **Please don't forward this email.** (Por favor, no reenvíes este correo.)

objectives: Identify and use common action verbs for email management
Give simple instructions using the imperative form
Use 'Please' to soften direct instructions in a work environment

keyTerms.definition: To answer a message or email.
To send a message you received to a new recipient.
To add a file (like a PDF or image) to an email.
